intro: Crotalaria rothiana, commonly known as the yellow cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with palmate leaves and erect stems. Its pods contain seeds that are used in traditional agriculture and as a source of protein. Crotalaria rothiana is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
